episodes.title: How Growing Up in a High-Control "Cult" Environment Silences Your Inner Voice
episodes.description:
In this video, I explore the psychological impact of being raised in a system where obedience, fear, and external authority replaced intuition, preference, and self-trust.

As a former Jehovah’s Witness, I learned very early that my inner voice wasn’t welcome — and many people who grew up in strict religious or controlling environments share this experience.

Today we go deeper into:
- why your intuition went quiet
- how your nervous system adapted to survive
- why decisions feel emotionally risky
and how you can slowly begin reconnecting with your true inner voice again

This is the bridge between understanding why decision-making feels difficult (yesterday’s video) and moving toward rebuilding self-trust and clarity.

If this resonates with your journey — whether you’re an ex-JW, ex-Christian, or anyone recovering from control — you’re not alone.

episodes.title: Why Former Jehovah’s Witnesses Struggle to Trust Their Own Decisions
episodes.description: Many former Jehovah’s Witnesses struggle to trust their own decisions after leaving — not because we’re weak, but because we were trained to outsource every choice to an organization, elders, or doctrine. In this video, I talk about what happens to your inner voice in a high-control environment, why decision-making feels scary after you leave, and how we slowly rebuild independence and confidence again
